**Scissors** are a type of [tool](/wiki/Tool "Tool") that appears in [NetHack brass](/wiki/NetHack_brass "NetHack brass").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Messages](#Messages)
- [4 Dudley's dungeon](#Dudley.27s_dungeon)
- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

Scissors are generated 25% [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed"), 50% [uncursed](/wiki/Uncursed "Uncursed"), and 25% [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed").

In addition to random generation, general [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and hardware stores can sell scissors.

## Description

[Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a pair of scissors allows you to cut a [cloth](/wiki/Cloth "Cloth") item up, destroying it and potentially producing a number of [bandages](/wiki/Bandage "Bandage") depending on the item chosen:

| Item                                                                                                                                                                | Amount (before adjustments)                  |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------- |
| [mummy wrapping](/wiki/Mummy_wrapping "Mummy wrapping")                                                                                                             | 1 bandage                                    |
| [kitchen apron](/index.php?title=Kitchen_apron\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Kitchen apron (page does not exist)"), [frilled apron](/wiki/Frilled_apron "Frilled apron") | 3 bandages                                   |
| [towel](/wiki/Towel "Towel"), [T-shirt](/wiki/T-shirt "T-shirt"), [Hawaiian shirt](/wiki/Hawaiian_shirt "Hawaiian shirt")                                           | 5 bandages                                   |
| [nurse uniform](/wiki/Nurse_uniform "Nurse uniform")                                                                                                                | 7 bandages                                   |
| other [cloth](/wiki/Cloth "Cloth") items                                                                                                                            | [weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight") divided by 4 |

A [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer") or any [female](/wiki/Female "Female") character wearing a [nurse cap](/wiki/Nurse_cap "Nurse cap") or [nurse uniform](/wiki/Nurse_uniform "Nurse uniform") can reliably produce the amount of bandages shown above - other characters will produce any number of bandages between 0 and the aforementioned "cap" for that item, with a penalty to the amount of bandages made for using a cursed pair of scissors, as well as a penalty for having less than 18 [dexterity](/wiki/Dexterity "Dexterity"). If the result would be 0 bandages or less, the cloth item is destroyed without yielding any.

The new bandages inherit their [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude") from both the scissors and the cloth item that you cut, similar to a magic marker:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

|            |          | Scissors |          |          |
| ---------- | -------- | -------- | -------- | -------- |
|            |          | Blessed  | Uncursed | Cursed   |
| Cloth item | Blessed  | Blessed  | Blessed  | Uncursed |
|            | Uncursed | Blessed  | Uncursed | Cursed   |
|            | Cursed   | Uncursed | Cursed   | Cursed   |

Cutting existing bandages will destroy them. You cannot use scissors to cut an item you are wearing, and scissors cannot cut up any other [material](/wiki/Material "Material").

## Messages

- You can't cut that!

  You tried to cut a non-cloth item with scissors.

- You can't cut something you're wearing.

  You tried to cut a worn cloth item.

- You cut your \<item> asunder.

  You completely destroyed the item without producing any bandages.

- You cut your \<item> into a bandage.

  You produced one bandage.

- You cut your (item) into some bandages.

  You produced multiple bandages.

- Oops! \<count of bandages> slip(s) to the floor!

  You produced bandages without enough room in your [inventory](/wiki/Inventory "Inventory") to carry them.

- Oops! \<count of bandages> slip(s) away from you!

  As above, but you were underwater, on the [Plane of Air](/wiki/Plane_of_Air "Plane of Air"), or [engulfed](/wiki/Engulfed "Engulfed") by a monster.

## Dudley's dungeon

In the [11 June](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20070611) and [12 June 2007](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20070612) strips of [Dudley's dungeon](/wiki/Dudley%27s_dungeon "Dudley's dungeon"), [Dudley](/wiki/Dudley "Dudley") plays rock-paper-scissors by wielding an actual pair of scissors, scaring a [paper golem](/wiki/Paper_golem "Paper golem") into fleeing.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) use\_scissors, line 1492 of apply.c of NetHack brass 040923

From NetHackWiki

(
Name scissors
Appearance scissors
Base price 30 zm
Weight 5
Material iron
Monster use Will not be used by monsters.

Scissors are a type of tool that appears in NetHack brass.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Messages
  • 4 Dudley's dungeon
  • 5 References

Generation

Scissors are generated 25% blessed, 50% uncursed, and 25% cursed.

In addition to random generation, general shops and hardware stores can sell scissors.

Description

Applying a pair of scissors allows you to cut a cloth item up, destroying it and potentially producing a number of bandages depending on the item chosen:

Item Amount (before adjustments)
mummy wrapping 1 bandage
kitchen apron, frilled apron 3 bandages
towel, T-shirt, Hawaiian shirt 5 bandages
nurse uniform 7 bandages
other cloth items weight divided by 4

A Healer or any female character wearing a nurse cap or nurse uniform can reliably produce the amount of bandages shown above - other characters will produce any number of bandages between 0 and the aforementioned "cap" for that item, with a penalty to the amount of bandages made for using a cursed pair of scissors, as well as a penalty for having less than 18 dexterity. If the result would be 0 bandages or less, the cloth item is destroyed without yielding any.

The new bandages inherit their beatitude from both the scissors and the cloth item that you cut, similar to a magic marker:[1]

Bandage beatitude
Scissors
Blessed Uncursed Cursed
Cloth item Blessed Blessed Blessed Uncursed
Uncursed Blessed Uncursed Cursed
Cursed Uncursed Cursed Cursed

Cutting existing bandages will destroy them. You cannot use scissors to cut an item you are wearing, and scissors cannot cut up any other material.

Messages

You can't cut that!
You tried to cut a non-cloth item with scissors.
You can't cut something you're wearing.
You tried to cut a worn cloth item.
You cut your <item> asunder.
You completely destroyed the item without producing any bandages.
You cut your <item> into a bandage.
You produced one bandage.
You cut your (item) into some bandages.
You produced multiple bandages.
Oops! <count of bandages> slip(s) to the floor!
You produced bandages without enough room in your inventory to carry them.
Oops! <count of bandages> slip(s) away from you!
As above, but you were underwater, on the Plane of Air, or engulfed by a monster.

Dudley's dungeon

In the 11 June and 12 June 2007 strips of Dudley's dungeon, Dudley plays rock-paper-scissors by wielding an actual pair of scissors, scaring a paper golem into fleeing.

References

  1. ↑ use_scissors, line 1492 of apply.c of NetHack brass 040923
